Notes: Includes everything except motors wheels motordriver sensors and microcontroller. Also I inscluded the shipping price into this

Specifications: JSUMO JS19198 - JSUMO ProFast Motors 5900 rpm 12v
Notes: This is a risk. 6000 n20 have a really low torque so getting the kit is reasonable just in case these dont have enough torque.
These are the wheels I am using
column9: they are 20x42mm and are sillicone high grip wheels.

Specifications: Mega 2560 Pro Mini Embed CH340G ATmega 2560-16A
Notes: Compact version of Arduino Mega with plenty of I/O pins for sensors and motor control. Good alternative to Teensy with lower cost.
Decent cheap motordriver. I am not very familiar with it but it seems to work well with the teensy 4.0 and the motors.
A 5v buck works well since teensy 4.0 needs 5v to run and outputs the 3v i need for the sensors.
These are known as the best sensors besides the qtrx which are like twice the price. Not too familiar with them and will have to be careful with them since they are quite expensive.
